dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Rafael Bourla just announced BioNTech and Johnson & Johnson are applying for EMA emergency approval of their Covid vaccine in the second week of October.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rafael Bourla just announced BioNTech and Johnson and Johnson are applying for E M A emergency approval of their Covid vaccine in the second week of October.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer will apply to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of its Covid-19 vaccine in the third week of November, its CEO said Friday, assuming it receives positive results from its ongoing trial the timeline makes it unlikely that the U.S. will have a vaccine before the election but leaves open the possibility of one being authorized this year. Bourlas statement cements Pfizers status as a frontrunner alongside Germanys BioNTech, who it is developing the vaccine with in the global race to develop a safe and effective Covid-19 vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge—and way ahead of what most people were expecting, especially compared to Moderna's timeline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge-and way ahead of what most people were expecting, especially compared to Moderna's timeline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he mentioned they need at least one month of safety data on a third of trial participants before the EMA will even consider it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he mentioned they need at least one month of safety data on a third of trial participants before the E M A will even consider it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FDA requires at least two months of safety data on half of trial participants to grant emergency approval, he said, as well as information on effectiveness and proof it can be manufactured safely.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but he also said they should know if the vaccine is ineffective by the end of November, which is still pretty quick.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but he also said they should know if the vaccine is ineffective by the end of November, which is still pretty quick.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The safety data is likely to take the longest to collect Bourla said Pfizer expects to have manufacturing data before that and should know whether or not the vaccine is effective by the end of October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—he emphasized that these are just estimates. Things could definitely shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-he emphasized that these are just estimates. Things could definitely shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bourla said the November timeline reflects the companys best estimates, noting that this could change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And you know, like, this whole race has gotten pretty politicized, especially with President Biden talking about a pre-election vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And you know, like, this whole race has gotten pretty politicized, especially with President Biden talking about a pre-election vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer and other vaccine-makers have grown increasingly frustrated with the persistent politicization of potential Covid-19 vaccines by high-ranking officials, most notably President Trump, who has claimed one will be ready before the November 3 election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—Bourla even mentioned in his statement that they want to clear up excitement and build public trust around the timelines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-Bourla even mentioned in his statement that they want to clear up excitement and build public trust around the timelines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bourlas letter does little to hide this annoyance,stating: To ensure public trust and clear up a great deal of confusion, I believe it is essential for the public to understand our estimated timelines for each of these three areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is smart, 'cause there's so much speculation and pressure right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is smart, 'cause there's so much speculation and pressure right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if they do stick to that October filing, BioNTech could be the first outside of Russia and China to get this kind of approval in Europe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if they do stick to that October filing, BioNTech could be the first outside of Russia and China to get this kind of approval in Europe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Excluding Russia and China, which have licensed vaccines for domestic use, no manufacturer has been granted regulatory approval for a vaccine anywhere in the world. If Pfizer manages to stick to this timeline, it could be the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a massive deal. But I wonder how the ongoing efficacy data collection for a full year plays into public perception.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a massive deal. But I wonder how the ongoing efficacy data collection for a full year plays into public perception.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company will continue to monitor and report safety data for all trial participants for two years, Bourla said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a long-term commitment, even with an emergency rollout. People might not realize that part.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a long-term commitment, even with an emergency rollout. People might not realize that part.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but honestly, any progress feels like a win right now. The partnership with Johnson & Johnson seems to be paying off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but honestly, any progress feels like a win right now. The partnership with Johnson and Johnson seems to be paying off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bourlas statement cements Pfizers status as a frontrunner alongside Germanys BioNTech, who it is developing the vaccine with in the global race to develop a safe and effective Covid-19 vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Let's see if the data backs up their optimism come October.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Let's see if the data backs up their optimism come October.

artist_script:
Rafael Bourla just announced BioNTech and Johnson & Johnson are applying for EMA emergency approval of their Covid vaccine in the second week of October.
HostB: That’s huge—and way ahead of what most people were expecting, especially compared to Moderna’s timeline.
HostA: Yeah, and he mentioned they need at least one month of safety data on a third of trial participants before the EMA will even consider it.
HostB: Right, but he also said they should know if the vaccine is ineffective by the end of November, which is still pretty quick.
HostA: It’s interesting though—he emphasized that these are just estimates. Things could definitely shift.
HostB: For sure. And you know, like, this whole race has gotten pretty politicized, especially with President Biden talking about a pre-election vaccine.
HostA: Exactly—Bourla even mentioned in his statement that they want to clear up excitement and build public trust around the timelines.
HostB: Which is smart, ‘cause there’s so much speculation and pressure right now.
HostA: And if they do stick to that October filing, BioNTech could be the first outside of Russia and China to get this kind of approval in Europe.
HostB: That’s a massive deal. But I wonder how the ongoing efficacy data collection for a full year plays into public perception.
HostA: Yeah, it’s a long-term commitment, even with an emergency rollout. People might not realize that part.
HostB: True, but honestly, any progress feels like a win right now. The partnership with Johnson & Johnson seems to be paying off.
HostA: Definitely. Let’s see if the data backs up their optimism come October.
